body_html: If you use resource variables this issue has been fixed. To use those, either do tf.Variable(..., use_resource=True), tf.get_variable(..., use_resource=True) or add a line saying tf.get_variable_scope().set_use_resource(True) somewhere before you start building graphs.
body_text: If you use resource variables this issue has been fixed. To use those, either do tf.Variable(..., use_resource=True), tf.get_variable(..., use_resource=True) or add a line saying tf.get_variable_scope().set_use_resource(True) somewhere before you start building graphs.
body: If you use resource variables this issue has been fixed. To use those, either do `tf.Variable(..., use_resource=True)`, `tf.get_variable(..., use_resource=True)` or add a line saying `tf.get_variable_scope().set_use_resource(True)` somewhere before you start building graphs.
